content: Can we make sure we tackle this one on our call next week? https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-28881
Agenda for today's call: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Minutes+CC+20210111
I'll be able to join for the first hour of today's call only; not sure if we're planning to go longer
1 hour works for me.
Voting for work group representatives

Today's agenda:

  • Voting for work group representatives (Lloyd McKenzie )
  • Bulk Data Block Vote #1 (Daniel Gottlieb )
  • SMART on FHIR Block Vote (Brett Marquard )

Please let me know if you have any additional topic to be discussed today.
I thought the SMART on FHIR block vote was targeting next week, but @Josh Mandel or @Brett Marquard can confirm?
Also, if there's time, it would be great to discuss/vote on the individual Bulk Data items that were pulled out of the block.
Yes, SMART App Launch block vote is for next week
If we're comfortable using hour 2 of today's call for bulk data "pulled" issues, that would work for me
Opps, sorry, it is 19th. updated.
(I'll be 15min late to today's call, but if we extend to hour 2, I'm happy to take over co-chairing and minutes, to make up for it :-))
Hi co-chairs, could we add FHIR#31720 to today's agenda, please? Thanks!
Agenda for Monday July-26 https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Minutes+CC+20210726
For our next call (post-WGM) would like to take up FHIR-33073 (quick clarification on SMART App Launch, thanks @Alexander Zautke )

This week (see https://confluence.hl7.org/display/FHIRI/FHIR+Infrastructure+Minutes+CC+2022-02-28) we voted on some Endpoint-related issues. After I mentioned this on an Argonaut call just now, someone pointed out that this resource doesn't belong to FHIR-I:

image.png
So, your vote changes to a recommendation to PA to adopt

For the 14 March call would like to add SMART Web Messaging Guide Publication Request to the agenda:

The CI build of the guide can be found here: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/smart-web-messaging/
The publication request is pending...

For next week's call, from #fhir/infrastructure-wg > Interfaces and ancestors and patterns

Here's a concrete proposal to discussion next week: https://jira.hl7.org/browse/FHIR-27839?focusedCommentId=198192&page=com.atlassian.jira.plugin.system.issuetabpanels%3Acomment-tabpanel#comment-198192

The goal is to satisfy all the concerns we heard on yesterday's call. As a reminder, because of issues like FHIR-25568 which have been outstanding for a year, nobody has really even seen the intended "normative" approach to interface hierarchies in practice -- so we shouldn't over-index on current-state.

just a reminder and update:

For the 14 March call would like to add SMART Web Messaging Guide Publication Request to the agenda:

The CI build of the guide can be found here: http://build.fhir.org/ig/HL7/smart-web-messaging/
The publication request is here: https://confluence.hl7.org/display/AP/Smart+Web+Messaging+STU1+Publication+Request

Our goal is to get approval on the call and take to FMG later in week.

The CG WG wants to put the approval of our publication request onto the agenda:
https://confluence.hl7.org/display/CGW/CG+IG+STU2+Publication
I think that's for FMG, not FHIR-I?
(I've thrown it on the FMG stream)
Hello wonderful co-chairs, would it be possible to add FHIR-36347 (search-related) to the agenda for Monday (March 21) please? Thanks =).

Hello to the intrepid band of FHIR-I co-chairs! If possible, I would like to perform my mostly-weekly task of requesting the addition of an obscure search-related ticket to the agenda for next Monday (FHIR-36683 to be specific). Please and thank you! :smiling_face:
you are consistent

John Moehrke said:

you are consistent

And hopefully the search page will be too ;-)
now that is just too far... be reasonable.

Lol. I figure if I'm bothering to work on the page, I may as well make it painful for everyone ;-)

Alas, I was a bit too quick on posting my request though.. if we could also add FHIR-36684, I would doubly appreciate it.
I joke... I am actually a big fan.

https://media3.giphy.com/media/l4hLVfpZQf1Ca0bhm/giphy-downsized-medium.gif?cid=c623cb35n7ut99nry89rdkzr3h4s85mv7gfe21liwj6al40n&rid=giphy-downsized-medium.gif&ct=g

:smiley:
and as anyone knows what happens when a Fan is placed infront of a FHIR
You get a mobile app?

Sorry to derail the fun, but I wanted to note for anyone following along at home that I added a large 'comment' to FHIR-36684 , to expand the scope from just covering the missing modifier to all of the modifiers. I thought this was easier than either: filing 11 new tickets (for each modifier), 26 new ones (for each discrete question) or even 1 umbrella (that would not include missing, since it was already filed).

Off-topic question, maybe a bit relatedâ€¦ Is there a list of all the tickets that are being applied to the new search page? After the re-write it might be hard to compare the page via a diff to see what fun new stuff needs to be implemented as a server developer? :sweat_smile:

Compared to what is in this thread? More on-topic than most =).

I have my 'work in progress' list of tickets that I am tracking, but will also do a complete pass of every 'search related' open ticket in Jira to cross-reference and post that list when I think the page is ready for review. My list is broken into sections and has duplicates so that I consider the right tickets when working in an area, so it will take some effort to be useful for anyone else (which I do not want to do until I am 'done' =). I believe it's in the 20's of discrete tickets right now, varying from 'one word' to 'this class of definitions does not appear to exist' amount of work per ticket.

Yes, the HTML diff is pretty painful.. even just 'correcting' examples (adding either JSON or XML so they have both and adding POST annotations) made it quite difficult to follow. I do post the arbitrary work in progress to this branch, so you can diff against R4... and yeah, it does not feel like a useful exercise.

Likely we will want to build out a specific 'changes' document to describe what is different, but that might have to be someone else manually comparing them, since I have no idea what other tickets were applied between R4 and now.
Maybe we can to this exercise as a community effort (once it's finished), as I suspect that a few people will need to go through the page.

That sounds wonderful. With the amount of content being added/changed, I was assuming detailed QA review before it could actually be considered as a candidate for merging. That type of review would go a long way to ensuring none of my mistakes become normative =)
@Gino Canessa I added FHIR-33683 into Monday's agenda. You also mentioned FHIR-33684. Do you want to add that ticket too?
Thanks @Yunwei Wang ! Yes, if we could add the second I would appreciate it
Note from today, added proposed disposition to FHIR-35168 for next week. Cheers!
